Description: Payment occurs relative to the start of the calculation period
Use Case: Used when payments need to be made at the beginning of interest accrual periods

Description: Payment occurs relative to the end of the calculation period
Use Case: Most common for standard interest rate swaps - pay after interest has accrued

Description: Payment occurs relative to the last pricing/fixing date
Use Case: Used for derivatives where payment timing depends on final pricing

Description: Payment occurs relative to the rate reset date
Use Case: Used when payment timing is tied to floating rate resets

Description: Payment occurs relative to the valuation date
Use Case: Used for complex derivatives where payment depends on asset valuation
